Class GUI

java.lang.Object
GUI
public class GUI
extends java.lang.Object
The GUI class generates a frame for the entire application. This is the one and only frame to be used in the application.
The frame is generated from the main() in Main class and closing the same will result in the termination of the application.

Since generating and disposing a frame could be expensive, I Emmanuel Jojy came up with an approach of maintaing the frame but yet providing dynamic GUI. My first approach was to make use of the CardLayout of java.awt package. Unfortunetly this could not provide for the desired result. The main issue was the contentPane added to the CardLayout needed to be changed each time there was a change in current user or new game needed to be started.
To overcome this problem, after a lot of research I decided to plug in JPanel as and when required to the frame. This idea was inspired from the Python Jinja framework where one would plug in Python semantics to HTML code. The field plug holds the currently actice plug of the frame. Though simple it may seem, it is a really powerful piece of code.

ps: I have used first person perspective because I really want you to understand the brainstorming that I did. In case you want to congratulate me don't hesitate contact me now. I will be at CSE department FISAT. I'm planning to take a patent on this. Just joking.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    GUI()
    Invokation of the constructor generates a new JFrame for the application.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void dashboard()
    Plugs the panel generated by Dashboard class into the JFrame.
    static void game()
    Plugs the panel generated by Game class into the JFrame.
    static void login()
    Plugs the panel generated by Access class into the JFrame.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • GUI

      public GUI()
      Invokation of the constructor generates a new JFrame for the application.

      By default the frame is set to open up in MAXIMISED_BOTH state. The size of the frame is hard code as 1366 x 720 to meet the requirements of the development phase. Sorry for any inconvinience beacuse of this.

      It invokes the login() method and this is the very reason why login page appears first.

  • Method Details

    • login

      public static void login()
      Plugs the panel generated by Access class into the JFrame. The plug is hardcoded with dimension 1366 X 720, reasons as specified for constructor.

    • dashboard

      public static void dashboard()
      Plugs the panel generated by Dashboard class into the JFrame. The plug is hardcoded with dimension 1366 X 720, reasons as specified for constructor.

    • game

      public static void game()
      Plugs the panel generated by Game class into the JFrame. The plug is hardcoded with dimension 1366 X 720, reasons as specified for constructor.
